title: Myrtleford, Victoria: Man found dead outside car after crash into tree
text:
A man has been found dead outside of his car after crashing into a tree on a winding Victorian tourist route.

Police believes he was driving on the Great Alpine Rd in Myrtleford, in the state’s northeast, shortly after 2am today when his vehicle left the road and hit a tree.

“A member of the public has come across the crash scene and located a male occupant deceased outside the car,” Victoria Police said in a statement.

A report will be prepared for the coroner.

Road blocks were established for traffic heading southeast on the Great Alpine Rd between the Myrtleford township and Happy Valley Rd.

The 339-kilometre road is a popular tourist route and runs from Wangaratta to Bairnsdale.

Anyone who may have witnessed the collision or with any information is urged to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.
description: A man has been found dead outside of his car after crashing into a tree on a winding Victorian tourist route.
